newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end up in volatile trading.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end up in volatile trading.

text.p: Pakistani stocks finished higher on Sunday in volatile trading, but dealers said sentiment was mixed due to possible political unrest.
They said a bitter political struggle could follow the Lahore High Court's decision to reinstate the ousted chief minister of Punjab province and could keep investors jittery.
The Karachi Stock Exchange 100-share index see-sawed to end up 9.64 points, or 0.66 percent, at 1,461.04. Losers led gainers 133 to 87.
Dewan Salman Fibre rose 2.30 rupees to 35.40 and Fauji Fertilizer climbed 2.25 to 80.75. -- Ovais Subhani 9221-5685192
